oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Maj. W. Jere Crook to Hattie Crook
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Maj. W. Jere Crook, 13th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, writes to his fiancee, Hattie Crook. He comments on their future marriage and wishes he could be her "Guardian Angel." Crook writes in vague terms about the war, describing places in Alabama rather than battles. He recounts seeing the "monster" gunboat "Memphis" under construction near Selma, Ala. W. J. Crook was from Henderson Co., Tenn. Hattie was a student at Columbia Female College. They were first cousins, once removed.
